definition: To receive possessions, assets, or property from a deceased person through legal inheritance. This term is commonly used in legal and familial contexts, referring to the transfer of wealth or belongings from one generation to another.

examples.german: Ich werde von meinem Großvater erben.
examples.english: I will inherit from my grandfather.

examples.german: Sie hat ein großes Vermögen geerbt.
Er hat das Haus von seinen Eltern geerbt.
examples.english: He inherited the house from his parents.

examples.german: Die Kinder werden das Unternehmen erben.
examples.english: The children will inherit the company.

examples.german: Sie erbt die Schönheit ihrer Mutter.
examples.english: She inherits the beauty of her mother.
